subject: Re: [junit] Disallowing file system access
msgSnippet: ... Yes, that would be an alternative to baking your own SecurityManager I guess. Thanks. ... I know there are several views on how to define a unit test, but
messageBody:
>You can run your program with a policy file that disallows access to the
>file system.

Yes, that would be an alternative to baking your own SecurityManager I
guess. Thanks.

>Why do you want to check whether your tests depend having disk access, if I
>may ask?

I know there are several views on how to define a unit test, but for me a
"pure" unit test cannot depend on the file system or anything else outside
the JVM. This rule keeps the tests fast and (more important) isolated. The
JUnit tests that do depend on non-JVM resources may be important too but I
don't call them unit tests.

Having these dependency rules checked automatically on my unit test suite
would be really great. Just in case I, or another developer in my team,
forget about the rule...
